page.title: 01 LANDSCAPE of WICKHAM MARKET
page.content: Wickham Market stands on a hill overlooking the Deben valley, on the old A12 London to Gt. Yarmouth road. Formally an important market town, it had until recently known a long period of decline. A new bypass has taken the heavy traffic out of the village centre. This, coupled with numereous housing developments has revitalized retail trade to the point where traffic is again a problem in the centre. A modern health clinic and care home for the elderly lie near the old union workhouse. New buildings mingle in with the old giving a varied pattern of archicture. The large village primary school, formaly an area school, marks the boundary the new estates and open farmland. Arable crops dominates the countryside and the motorcar is the most popular means of transportation.
